result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W Leisten Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid in full by 07-01-2015 or serve 9 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay costs/surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey W Leisten Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jeffrey W Leisten in court, in custody.  

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
10 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to any other sentence.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid in full by:  07/01/15.
Alternate: 9 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Jeffrey W Leisten in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jorge Fragoso appears as friend of the court.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
